content.full_text:
Receipt of Abraham Lincoln to John Brodie, 17 November 18411 Received,Springfield,Nov. 17th1841ofJohn Brodie, administrator ofArchibald Hooddeceased, ten dollars, being in full for a fee which said Hood owed me, and also

the only debt he owed me—2
paragraphs: Receipt of Abraham Lincoln to John Brodie, 17 November 18411 Received,Springfield,Nov. 17th1841ofJohn Brodie, administrator ofArchibald Hooddeceased, ten dollars, being in full for a fee which said Hood owed me, and also
the only debt he owed me—2
citations: Hood v. Gray, Martha L. Benner and Cullom Davis et al., eds.,The Law Practice of Abraham Lincoln: Complete Documentary Edition, 2d edition (Springfield: Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, 2009),http://lawpracticeofabrahamlincoln.org/Details.aspx?case=139254.

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed this document.

2In March 1840, Hood had retainedStuart & Lincolnto sue for a debt in theSangamon County Circuit Court. The jury found for Hood and awarded $100. Lincoln received $10 for his services
                  in representing Hood.Hood v. Gray, Martha L. Benner and Cullom Davis et al., eds.,The Law Practice of Abraham Lincoln: Complete Documentary Edition, 2d edition (Springfield: Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, 2009),http://lawpracticeofabrahamlincoln.org/Details.aspx?case=139254.
